The file content with the documentation metadata removed is:

<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- PGOInstrumentation.cpp - MST-based PGO Instrumentation -------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements PGO instrumentation using a minimum spanning tree based</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// on the following paper:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#91;1&#93; Donald E. Knuth, Francis R. Stevenson. Optimal measurement of points</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for program frequency counts. BIT Numerical Mathematics 1973, Volume 13,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Issue 3, pp 313-322</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The idea of the algorithm based on the fact that for each node (except for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the entry and exit), the sum of incoming edge counts equals the sum of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// outgoing edge counts. The count of edge on spanning tree can be derived from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// those edges not on the spanning tree. Knuth proves this method instruments</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the minimum number of edges.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The minimal spanning tree here is actually a maximum weight tree -- on-tree</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// edges have higher frequencies (more likely to execute). The idea is to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instrument those less frequently executed edges to reduce the runtime</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// overhead of instrumented binaries.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file contains two passes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (1) Pass PGOInstrumentationGen which instruments the IR to generate edge</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// count profile, and generates the instrumentation for indirect call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// profiling.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (2) Pass PGOInstrumentationUse which reads the edge count profile and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// annotates the branch weights. It also reads the indirect call value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// profiling records and annotate the indirect call instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To get the precise counter information, These two passes need to invoke at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the same compilation point (so they see the same IR). For pass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PGOInstrumentationGen, the real work is done in instrumentOneFunc(). For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pass PGOInstrumentationUse, the real work in done in class PGOUseFunc and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the profile is opened in module level and passed to each PGOUseFunc instance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The shared code for PGOInstrumentationGen and PGOInstrumentationUse is put</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in class FuncPGOInstrumentation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Class PGOEdge represents a CFG edge and some auxiliary information. Class</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// BBInfo contains auxiliary information for each BB. These two classes are used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in pass PGOInstrumentationGen. Class PGOUseEdge and UseBBInfo are the derived</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// class of PGOEdge and BBInfo, respectively. They contains extra data structure</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// used in populating profile counters.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The MST implementation is in Class CFGMST (CFGMST.h).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/instrumentation/pgoinstrumentation-h">llvm/Transforms/Instrumentation/PGOInstrumentation.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/instrumentation/valueprofilecollector-h">ValueProfileCollector.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Need to add two new edges. First one: Add new edge of SrcBB-&gt;InstrBB.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1534"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If A is covered and B is covered, set weight=1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1535"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If A is covered and B is uncovered, set weight=0.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1536"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If A is uncovered, set weight=1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This setup will allow BFI to give nonzero profile counts to only covered</span></CodeLine>
